intro: Azorella cockaynei, commonly known as the Chilean hair grass, is a perennial plant native to the high altitudes of southern South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Azorella cockaynei is well adapted to cold, arid environments and can survive in nutrient-poor soils.
